channel.title: Making Myself a mod in my server
channel.description: Hey gys, I just recently made a server with Testscape source. Now im tyring to make me an admin. I do the make rights 3 and stuff.. then i go into my server and it doesnt work. I go back to the notepad and it goes back to 0.. Any ideas?? Pleas ehelp

item.title: Making Myself a mod in my server
item.dc:creator: @Blazpkr Blazpkr
item.description:
@Blazpkr wrote:

Ok dude what i recommend is. Uninstalling all your javas because if you do not know which ones u have uninstall them all and only install the ones you need. Which can be found on another topic somewere. Then when you have got the javas running. Go on to your moparscape server. Run the server. To make sure that works then the next step. If you want to make yourself a moderator on your server. Then you need to set your classpaths by doing that you go onto Mycomputer on the start menu do not left it right click it and select properties. Then click the advanced tab and go on evrionmental Variables. Then you need to set them to this. Click the top New Button. And type PATH in capitals. Then for the value put this. C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_05\bin. Once that is done make another new one and call it CLASSPATH. And for the value put this. SET CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%; . Then go onto your servers source. And look for the notepad file client i know it confuses people saying client.java because it doesnt actually say that unless u keep hold of it anyway. Now Press Ctrl and F together. Ok and type Admin press it around 3 or 4 times until you find this //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Yourname”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Your Name”))
Then in there were i have put your name put your admin name or whatever you want to do. And the change the player rights to what type of thing you want to be. Ok next step. After you have done that go on file and click save. Then Click on Compile. And you should a get message saying. Note:: Stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note::Recompile with -Xlint ::deprecation for details Press any key to continue. If you get that it will be correct. Then Click on run server and it should be working. If you choose player rights 3 note you will not see your crown but others will. If you put yourself as mod or admin everyone will see your crown and so will you. If you need anything else feel free to add me on tookool3113@hotmail.co.uk. I hope i have helped:)

Read full topic

open client.java, search for
//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
